ground_truth: Natalie spins around and heads off. Ryan looks out of the window of a jet as it rises into the sky. In Las Vegas, Alex holds the cut-out of Julie and Jim in front of the pyramid-shaped Luxor Hotel. Ryan aims the digital camera, and Alex moves the cut-out closer. He takes a picture while Alex stares at the cut-out. Ryan smiles, and Alex looks surprised before smiling warmly. In Milwaukee, a jet comes in to land. Alex and Ryan walk through the airport terminal, with him pulling a black wheelie case and her a similar, neat red one. Later, they walk into the Chalet Suites, a Swiss lodge-themed hotel, and join a short queue of people checking in. Ryan notices a second counter with no queue. As Ryan opens a hotel room door, his sister Kara walks up holding a basket of washing. Alex and Ryan walk into their gaudily furnished room, where Ryan picks up a photocopied booklet with a picture of Julie and Jim on the front. Julie hugs Ryan, and Jim comes over. There's a large map of the U.S. on the wall, pinned with several photos of the cut-out of Julie and Jim in front of famous landmarks. Ryan steps back and looks at the map, covered in photographs, smiles thoughtfully, and goes back to join Alex, Julie, and Jim, pointing at the map. Later, at the bar, Alex goes back in while Ryan waits outside with Julie and Kara. They smile, and Julie nods and looks down sadly as Kara looks at her, with a box of flower arrangements nearby. Ryan drives up to his old school with Alex, and they get out of the car, looking at the long, low building. They tramp across some snow and walk up to the entrance. Ryan tries the door, finding it locked, and peers inside to see darkness. He turns to Alex resignedly, but she grins and goes to a window, undoes a catch with a credit card, and pulls it open. He grabs her foot and heaves her up, and they both clamber into a classroom, where they look at old newspaper photos of the basketball team and a picture in a trophy case. Outside by a loading bay, they sit on the stairs and kiss. In the gym, they watch the basketball team practice and grin at each other. Kara calls, so Alex drops Ryan off by the church. Ryan runs up to the church entrance, opens the door, and runs up some stairs. He walks into the church and finds Julie, in white, sitting with her bridesmaids, who wear cerise, crying. They see Ryan, and Kara goes over to him as he looks at Julie, who wipes tears from her eyes.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Natalie twirls around and heads off. Ryan gazes out of the pane of a plane as it ascends into the atmosphere. In Las Vegas, Alex grips the cut-out of Julie and Jim in front of the pyramid-shaped Luxor Hotel. Ryan targets the digital camera, and Alex shifts the cut-out nearer. He snaps a photograph while Alex gazes at the cut-out. Ryan grins, and Alex appears astonished before grinning warmly. In Milwaukee, a plane descends to land. Alex and Ryan stroll through the airport terminal, with him hauling a black wheelie case and her a similar, tidy red one. Later, they proceed into the Chalet Suites, a Swiss lodge-themed inn, and join a short queue of individuals checking in. Ryan observes a second counter with no queue. Ryan steps back and gazes at the chart, covered in photographs, smiles ponderously, and returns to join Alex, Julie, and Jim, indicating the chart. Later, at the tavern, Alex returns while Ryan waits outside with Julie and Kara. They smile, and Julie nods and gazes down sorrowfully as Kara observes her, with a box of floral arrangements nearby. Ryan drives up to his old school with Alex, and they exit the vehicle, examining the long, low structure. They trudge across some snow and approach the entry. Ryan tests the door, discovering it locked, and peers inside to discern darkness. He turns to Alex resignedly, but she grins and goes to a window, undoes a latch with a credit card, and pulls it open. He grabs her shoe and hoists her up, and they both scramble into a classroom, where they examine aged newspaper images of the basketball squad and a picture in a trophy case. They see Ryan, and Kara goes over to him as he gazes at Julie, who wipes tears from her eyes.

Ryan takes a picture, and Alex smiles warmly. In Milwaukee, a jet lands. Alex and Ryan walk through the airport with matching luggage. Ryan picks up a booklet featuring Julie and Jim. Julie hugs Ryan, and Jim joins. A U.S. map on the wall is pinned with photos of the cut-out at landmarks. Ryan smiles at the map and joins Alex, Julie, and Jim. Later, at the bar, Alex returns inside while Ryan waits with Julie and Kara, who looks at flower arrangements. Kara approaches Ryan as he looks at Julie, who wipes her tears.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: Natalie gracefully spins around and confidently heads off in a new direction. Meanwhile, Ryan gazes out of the window of a jet as it majestically ascends into the vast sky. In the vibrant city of Las Vegas, Alex holds up the cut-out figures of Julie and Jim, positioning them in front of the iconic, pyramid-shaped Luxor Hotel. Ryan carefully aims the digital camera, and Alex adjusts the cut-out, moving it closer for the perfect shot. He captures the picture while Alex intently stares at the cut-out. Ryan's face lights up with a smile, and Alex, initially surprised, soon mirrors his expression with a warm smile of her own. In Milwaukee, a jet gracefully descends, preparing to land. Alex and Ryan make their way through the bustling airport terminal, with Ryan pulling a sleek black wheelie case and Alex managing a similar, neatly packed red one. Later on, they enter the Chalet Suites, a hotel with a charming Swiss lodge theme, and join a short line of people waiting to check in. Ryan's keen eye spots a second counter with no queue at all. As Ryan opens the door to their hotel room, his sister Kara approaches, holding a basket filled with laundry. Alex and Ryan step into their vividly decorated room, where Ryan picks up a photocopied booklet featuring a picture of Julie and Jim on the cover. Julie warmly embraces Ryan, and Jim soon joins them. A large map of the United States adorns the wall, covered with several pinned photos of the cut-out of Julie and Jim in front of various famous landmarks. Ryan steps back to admire the map, thoughtfully taking in the photographs, before returning to join Alex, Julie, and Jim, pointing out details on the map. Later, at the bar, Alex heads back inside while Ryan waits outside with Julie and Kara. They exchange smiles, and Julie nods, looking down with a hint of sadness as Kara observes her, with a box of flower arrangements nearby. Ryan drives up to his old school with Alex, and they both exit the car, taking in the sight of the long, low building. They trudge across the snow and approach the entrance. Ryan tries the door, only to find it locked, and peers inside to see nothing but darkness. He turns to Alex with a resigned expression, but she grins mischievously and heads to a window, skillfully undoing a catch with a credit card and pulling it open. He grabs her foot, giving her a boost, and they both clamber into a classroom, where they examine old newspaper photos of the basketball team and a picture displayed in a trophy case. Outside by a loading bay, they sit on the stairs and share a kiss. In the gym, they watch the basketball team practice, exchanging grins with each other. Kara calls, prompting Alex to drop Ryan off by the church. Ryan runs up to the church entrance, opens the door, and quickly ascends some stairs. He enters the church and finds Julie, dressed in white, sitting with her bridesmaids, who are adorned in cerise, all crying. They notice Ryan, and Kara approaches him as he looks at Julie, who wipes tears from her eyes.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
Natalie, with an elegant and graceful flourish, spins around completely, then, with a confident and assured demeanor, heads off decidedly in a new direction. Meanwhile, Ryan is seated inside a jet, his gaze fixed intently out of the window as the aircraft begins its majestic ascent into the vast, expansive sky above. In the vibrant and bustling city of Las Vegas, Alex holds up the figures of Julie and Jim, carefully crafted from cut-outs, positioning them skillfully in front of the iconic and pyramid-shaped Luxor Hotel, a prominent landmark known for its grandeur. Ryan, with a careful and attentive eye, aims the digital camera, and Alex adjusts the cut-out figures with precision, moving them purposefully closer for what promises to be the perfect shot. At this moment, Ryan successfully captures the picture, all while Alex intently focuses on the cut-out figures. Ryan's face soon lights up with a genuine smile of delight and satisfaction, and Alex, initially taken aback by surprise, soon reflects his sentiment, rewarding him with a warm, mirroring smile of her own.

In another location, specifically in Milwaukee, a jet makes a graceful and smooth descent, as it prepares to land with precision. Alex and Ryan navigate their way through the bustling, crowded airport terminal, with Ryan rolling along a sleek, black wheelie case and Alex managing a similar, neatly packed red one with ease. Later on, they find themselves at the Chalet Suites, a hotel known for its charming Swiss lodge theme, where they join a short line of people waiting patiently to check in. Ryan's keen and observant eye spots a second counter that is completely devoid of any queue. As Ryan opens the door to their hotel room, his sister Kara approaches, carrying a basket filled with laundry, her presence adding a familial touch. Alex and Ryan enter the vividly and colorfully decorated room, where Ryan picks up a photocopied booklet that features a picture of Julie and Jim prominently on the cover. In a warm gesture, Julie embraces Ryan, and Jim soon joins them, completing the supportive circle. 

Adorning one of the walls is a large map of the United States, covered with several pinned photographs of the cut-out images of Julie and Jim positioned in front of various famous landmarks across the country. Ryan steps back for a moment, taking the time to admire the map, thoughtfully taking in all the photographs, before returning to join Alex, Julie, and Jim, pointing out and discussing the details on the map. Later on, at the bar, Alex returns inside while Ryan waits patiently outside with Julie and Kara. A series of smiles are exchanged, and Julie nods, looking down with a subtle hint of sadness, as Kara observes her, a box of flower arrangements sitting close by. 

Ryan drives up to his old school, with Alex by his side, and both step out of the car, pausing to take in the sight of the long, low building that stands before them. They trudge across the snow-covered ground, making their way towards the entrance. Ryan attempts to open the door, only to discover it is securely locked, and peers inside to see nothing but darkness. Turning to Alex with an expression of resignation, he is met with her mischievous grin as she heads to a window, skillfully undoing a catch with nothing more than a credit card, pulling it open. He then grabs her foot, giving her a boost, and they both clamber inside a classroom, where they examine old newspaper clippings of the basketball team and a picture displayed within a trophy case. Outside, by a loading bay, they sit together on the stairs, sharing a tender kiss. 

In the gymnasium, they watch the basketball team engaged in practice, exchanging amused grins with each other. A call from Kara prompts Alex to take Ryan to the church, where he is let off. Ryan runs up to the church entrance, opens the door, and swiftly makes his way up the stairs. Inside the church, he finds Julie dressed elegantly in white, seated with her bridesmaids, who are adorned in striking cerise, all shedding tears. Noticing Ryan's arrival, Kara approaches him as Ryan looks at Julie, who gently wipes tears from her eyes in a moment filled with emotion.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Natalie executes a swift spin on her heel and begins to move away with purpose. Meanwhile, Ryan is seated inside a jet, his gaze fixed out the window as the aircraft ascends steadily into the sky. In the vibrant city of Las Vegas, Alex stands holding a cut-out of Julie and Jim, positioning it carefully in front of the iconic pyramid-shaped Luxor Hotel. Ryan, with a digital camera in hand, carefully aims to capture the perfect shot, while Alex adjusts the cut-out, moving it closer to the camera's lens. As Ryan presses the shutter to take the picture, Alex's eyes remain fixed on the cut-out, her expression one of concentration. Ryan's face breaks into a smile, and Alex, initially taken aback, soon mirrors his expression with a warm smile of her own. In Milwaukee, a jet descends gracefully, preparing to land. Inside the airport terminal, Alex and Ryan make their way through the bustling space, Ryan pulling a sleek black wheelie case behind him, while Alex maneuvers a similar, neatly packed red one. Later, they enter the Chalet Suites, a hotel with a charming Swiss lodge theme, and join a short line of guests waiting to check in. Ryan's eyes scan the area and he notices a second counter that is free of any queue. As Ryan pushes open the door to a hotel room, his sister Kara approaches, balancing a basket of laundry in her arms. Alex and Ryan step into their room, which is furnished in a garish style, and Ryan's attention is drawn to a photocopied booklet featuring a picture of Julie and Jim on the cover. Julie greets Ryan with a hug, and Jim soon joins them. On the wall, a large map of the U.S. is adorned with numerous photos of the cut-out of Julie and Jim posed in front of various famous landmarks. Ryan steps back to take in the map, his eyes scanning the photographs, and a thoughtful smile spreads across his face before he returns to join Alex, Julie, and Jim, gesturing towards the map. Later, at the bar, Alex heads back inside while Ryan remains outside with Julie and Kara. They exchange smiles, and Julie nods, her gaze dropping sadly as Kara observes her, a box of flower arrangements resting nearby. Ryan drives up to his old school with Alex, and they exit the car, taking a moment to look at the long, low building before them. They trudge across a patch of snow and approach the entrance. Ryan tries the door, only to find it locked, and peers through the glass to see nothing but darkness inside. He turns to Alex with a resigned expression, but she responds with a grin, moving to a nearby window. With deft fingers, she uses a credit card to undo the catch and pulls the window open. Ryan grabs hold of her foot, giving her a boost, and they both clamber into a classroom. Inside, they take in the sight of old newspaper photos of the basketball team and a picture displayed in a trophy case. Later, outside by a loading bay, they sit together on the stairs and share a kiss. In the gym, they watch the basketball team practice, exchanging grins of shared enjoyment. Kara calls, prompting Alex to drop Ryan off by the church. Ryan runs up to the church entrance, pushes open the door, and dashes up a flight of stairs. He enters the church to find Julie, dressed in white, sitting with her bridesmaids, who are adorned in cerise, all of them in tears. As they notice Ryan, Kara approaches him, and he looks at Julie, who wipes tears from her eyes, her emotions laid bare.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Natalie spins around and leaves. Ryan gazes out the window as the jet ascends. In Las Vegas, Alex holds a cut-out of Julie and Jim in front of the Luxor Hotel while Ryan takes a picture, capturing Alex's surprise and subsequent warm smile. In Milwaukee, they land and walk through the airport with their luggage. They enter the Chalet Suites, a Swiss lodge-themed hotel, and join a short check-in queue, but Ryan notices an empty counter. As they enter their room, Ryan's sister Kara approaches with laundry. Inside, Ryan examines a booklet featuring Julie and Jim, and they reunite with hugs. A U.S. map on the wall displays photos of the cut-out at landmarks, prompting Ryan to smile thoughtfully before rejoining the group to discuss the map. Later, at the bar, Alex returns inside while Ryan stays with Julie and Kara, who share a somber moment near flower arrangements. Ryan and Alex visit his old school, trudging through snow to find the door locked. Alex ingeniously opens a window, and they climb into a classroom to reminisce over old photos. They share a kiss outside by the loading bay stairs. In the gym, they watch a basketball practice, exchanging grins. Kara calls, prompting Alex to drop Ryan at the church. He rushes inside to find Julie, in white, with her bridesmaids, who are in cerise, crying. Kara approaches Ryan as he looks at Julie, who wipes her tears.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Natalie spins around and heads off briskly, perhaps driven by a newfound purpose. Ryan looks out of the window of a jet as it rises into the sky, leaving behind the bustling city of Los Angeles, a major hub for travelers to various destinations. In Las Vegas, famous for its vibrant nightlife and entertainment, Alex holds the cut-out of Julie and Jim in front of the pyramid-shaped Luxor Hotel, a prominent resort known for its striking architecture and entertainment events. Ryan aims the digital camera, a compact device that has revolutionized photography with its easy-to-use technology, and Alex moves the cut-out closer. He takes a picture while Alex stares at the cut-out, perhaps captivated by the seemingly real image against the iconic hotel. Ryan smiles, a gesture of satisfaction, and Alex looks surprised before smiling warmly, a moment of shared enjoyment captured. In Milwaukee, a city known for its brewing traditions and cultural festivals, a jet comes in to land. Alex and Ryan walk through the airport terminal, with him pulling a black wheelie case and her a similar, neat red one, both designed for easy maneuverability. Later, they walk into the Chalet Suites, a Swiss lodge-themed hotel that offers a cozy atmosphere reminiscent of alpine retreats, and join a short queue of people checking in. Ryan notices a second counter with no queue, a strategic observation highlighting his knack for efficiency. As Ryan opens a hotel room door, his sister Kara walks up holding a basket of washing, a mundane task that roots their journey in everyday life. Alex and Ryan walk into their gaudily furnished room, where Ryan picks up a photocopied booklet with a picture of Julie and Jim on the front, a personalized souvenir encapsulating memories of their travels. Julie hugs Ryan, a warm embrace conveying a deep bond, and Jim comes over, reflecting camaraderie. There's a large map of the U.S. on the wall, pinned with several photos of the cut-out of Julie and Jim in front of famous landmarks like the Grand Canyon and the Statue of Liberty. Ryan steps back and looks at the map, covered in photographs, smiles thoughtfully, and goes back to join Alex, Julie, and Jim, pointing at the map as if planning their next adventure. Later, at the bar, a common place for social gatherings, Alex goes back in while Ryan waits outside with Julie and Kara. They smile, and Julie nods and looks down sadly as Kara looks at her, with a box of flower arrangements nearby, suggesting preparations for a significant event. Ryan drives up to his old school with Alex, and they get out of the car, looking at the long, low building, which holds countless memories from his childhood. They tramp across some snow, a reminder of the harsh Midwest winters, and walk up to the entrance. Ryan tries the door, finding it locked, and peers inside to see darkness, much like the closed chapter of his past. He turns to Alex resignedly, but she grins and goes to a window, undoes a catch with a credit card, demonstrating her resourcefulness, and pulls it open. He grabs her foot and heaves her up, and they both clamber into a classroom where they look at old newspaper photos of the basketball team, reflecting a legacy of the school’s sports achievements, and a picture in a trophy case, symbolizing past victories. Outside by a loading bay, they sit on the stairs and kiss, sealing a moment of intimacy. In the gym, where echoes of cheering fans once filled the air, they watch the basketball team practice and grin at each other, their shared enjoyment evident. Kara calls, so Alex drops Ryan off by the church, an architectural landmark in the community. Ryan runs up to the church entrance, opens the door, and runs up some stairs, driven by a sense of urgency. He walks into the church and finds Julie, in white, sitting with her bridesmaids, who wear cerise, crying, a poignant scene at what should be a joyous occasion. They see Ryan, and Kara goes over to him as he looks at Julie, who wipes tears from her eyes, a tender moment of support and comfort.

test_cases.name: Addition (~50%)
test_cases.description: Natalie spins around and heads off. Ryan looks out of the window of a jet as it rises into the sky. In Las Vegas Alex holds the cutout of Julie and Jim in front of the pyramidshaped Luxor Hotel. Ryan aims the digital camera and Alex moves the cutout closer. He takes a picture while Alex stares at the cutout. Ryan smiles and Alex looks surprised before smiling warmly. In Milwaukee a jet comes in to land. Alex and Ryan walk through the airport terminal with him pulling a black wheelie case and her a similar neat red one. Later they walk into the Chalet Suites a Swiss lodgethemed hotel and join a short queue of people checking in. Ryan notices a second counter with no queue. As Ryan opens a hotel room door his sister Kara walks up holding a basket of washing. Alex and Ryan walk into their gaudily furnished room where Ryan picks up a photocopied booklet with a picture of Julie and Jim on the front. Julie hugs Ryan and Jim comes over. There is a large map of the US on the wall pinned with several photos of the cutout of Julie and Jim in front of famous landmarks. Ryan steps back and looks at the map covered in photographs smiles thoughtfully and goes back to join Alex. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. Julie and Jim pointing at the map. Later at the bar Alex goes back in while Ryan waits outside with Julie and Kara. They smile and Julie nods and looks down sadly as Kara looks at her with a box of flower arrangements nearby. Ryan drives up to his old school with Alex and they get out of the car looking at the long low building. They tramp across some snow and walk up to the entrance. Ryan tries the door finding it locked and peers inside to see darkness. He turns to Alex resignedly but she grins and goes to a window undoes a catch with a credit card and pulls it open. He grabs her foot and heaves her up and they both clamber into a classroom where they look at old newspaper photos of the basketball team and a picture in a trophy case. Outside by a loading bay they sit on the stairs and kiss. In the gym they watch the basketball team practice and grin at each other. Kara calls so. Alex drops Ryan off by the church. Ryan runs up to the church entrance opens the door and runs up some stairs. He walks into the church and finds Julie in white sitting with her bridesmaids who wear cerise crying. They see Ryan and Kara goes over to him as he looks at Julie who wipes tears from her eyes.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: Natalie spins around and heads off. Ryan looks out of the window of a jet as it rises into the sky. In Las Vegas Alex holds the cutout of Julie and Jim in front of the pyramidshaped Luxor Hotel. Ryan aims the digital camera and Alex moves the cutout closer. He takes a picture while Alex stares at the cutout. Ryan smiles and Alex looks surprised before smiling warmly. In Milwaukee a jet comes in to land. Alex and Ryan walk through the airport terminal with him pulling a black wheelie case and her a similar neat red one. Later they walk into the Chalet Suites a Swiss lodgethemed hotel and join a short queue of people checking in. Ryan notices a second counter with no queue. As Ryan opens a hotel room door his sister Kara walks up holding a basket of washing. Alex and Ryan walk into their gaudily furnished room where Ryan picks up a photocopied booklet with a picture of Julie and Jim on the front. Julie hugs Ryan and Jim comes over. There is a large map of the US on the wall pinned with several photos of the cutout of Julie and Jim in front of famous landmarks. Ryan steps back and looks at the map covered in photographs smiles thoughtfully and goes back to join Alex. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. test_cases.name: Subject Corruption
test_cases.description: Natalie spins around and heads off. The dog looks out of the window of a jet as it rises into the sky. In Las Vegas, a robot holds the cut-out of Julie and Jim in front of the pyramid-shaped Luxor Hotel. The squirrel aims the digital camera, and the robot moves the cut-out closer. The squirrel takes a picture while the robot stares at the cut-out. The squirrel smiles, and the robot looks surprised before smiling warmly. In Milwaukee, a jet comes in to land. The robot and the squirrel walk through the airport terminal, with the squirrel pulling a black wheelie case and the robot a similar, neat red one. Later, they walk into the Chalet Suites, a Swiss lodge-themed hotel, and join a short queue of people checking in. The squirrel notices a second counter with no queue. As the squirrel opens a hotel room door, his sister the giraffe walks up holding a basket of washing. The robot and the squirrel walk into their gaudily furnished room, where the squirrel picks up a photocopied booklet with a picture of Julie and Jim on the front. Julie hugs the squirrel, and Jim comes over. There's a large map of the U.S. on the wall, pinned with several photos of the cut-out of Julie and Jim in front of famous landmarks. The squirrel steps back and looks at the map, covered in photographs, smiles thoughtfully, and goes back to join the robot, Julie, and Jim, pointing at the map. Later, at the bar, the robot goes back in while the squirrel waits outside with Julie and the giraffe. They smile, and Julie nods and looks down sadly as the giraffe looks at her, with a box of flower arrangements nearby. The squirrel drives up to his old school with the robot, and they get out of the car, looking at the long, low building. They tramp across some snow and walk up to the entrance. The squirrel tries the door, finding it locked, and peers inside to see darkness. He turns to the robot resignedly, but she grins and goes to a window, undoes a catch with a credit card, and pulls it open. The squirrel grabs her foot and heaves her up, and they both clamber into a classroom, where they look at old newspaper photos of the basketball team and a picture in a trophy case. Outside by a loading bay, they sit on the stairs and kiss. In the gym, they watch the basketball team practice and grin at each other. The giraffe calls, so the robot drops the squirrel off by the church. The squirrel runs up to the church entrance, opens the door, and runs up some stairs. He walks into the church and finds Julie, in white, sitting with her bridesmaids, who wear cerise, crying. They see the squirrel, and the giraffe goes over to him as he looks at Julie, who wipes tears from her eyes.

test_cases.name: Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Natalie spins around and heads off. Ryan looks out of the window of a balloon as it rises into the sky. In Paris, Alex holds the cut-out of Julie and Jim in front of the tower-shaped Eiffel Monument. Ryan aims the film camera, and Alex moves the cut-out closer. He takes a picture while Alex stares at the cut-out. Ryan smiles, and Alex looks surprised before smiling warmly. In Houston, a glider comes in to land. Alex and Ryan walk through the train station, with him pulling a black duffel bag and her a similar, neat blue one. Later, they walk into the Alpine Cabins, an Austrian inn-themed hotel, and join a short queue of people checking in. Ryan notices a second desk with no queue. As Ryan opens a suite door, his sister Kara walks up holding a basket of fruit. Alex and Ryan walk into their lavishly furnished room, where Ryan picks up a laminated booklet with a picture of Julie and Jim on the cover. Julie hugs Ryan, and Jim comes over. There's a large globe of the U.S. on the table, pinned with several photos of the cut-out of Julie and Jim in front of famous destinations. Ryan steps back and looks at the globe, covered in photographs, smiles thoughtfully, and goes back to join Alex, Julie, and Jim, pointing at the globe. Later, at the lounge, Alex goes back in while Ryan waits outside with Julie and Kara. They smile, and Julie nods and looks down sadly as Kara looks at her, with a crate of party decorations nearby. Ryan drives up to his old library with Alex, and they get out of the truck, looking at the long, low building. They tramp across some grass and walk up to the entrance. Ryan tries the door, finding it locked, and peers inside to see shadows. He turns to Alex resignedly, but she grins and goes to a window, undoes a catch with a paperclip, and pulls it open. He grabs her foot and heaves her up, and they both clamber into a reading room, where they look at old magazine photos of the chess club and a picture in a display cabinet. Outside by a delivery dock, they sit on the benches and kiss. In the theater, they watch the drama club rehearse and grin at each other. Kara calls, so Alex drops Ryan off by the gallery. Ryan runs up to the gallery entrance, opens the door, and runs up some stairs. He walks into the gallery and finds Julie, in white, sitting with her attendants, who wear teal, crying. They see Ryan, and Kara goes over to him as he looks at Julie, who wipes tears from her eyes.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Natalie twirls around and dashes off. Ryan gazes out of the window of a jet as it floats into the sky. In Las Vegas, Alex balances the cut-out of Julie and Jim in front of the pyramid-shaped Luxor Hotel. Ryan adjusts the digital camera, and Alex nudges the cut-out aside. He snaps a picture while Alex glances at the cut-out. Ryan chuckles, and Alex looks bewildered before chuckling warmly. In Milwaukee, a jet prepares to ascend. Alex and Ryan stroll through the airport terminal, with him dragging a black wheelie case and her a similar, tidy red one. Later, they enter the Chalet Suites, a Swiss lodge-themed hotel, and stand in a short line of people checking in. Ryan spots a second counter with no line. As Ryan closes a hotel room door, his sister Kara approaches holding a basket of laundry. Alex and Ryan step into their garishly decorated room, where Ryan lifts a photocopied booklet with a picture of Julie and Jim on the cover. Julie pats Ryan, and Jim wanders over. There's a large map of the U.S. on the wall, plastered with several photos of the cut-out of Julie and Jim in front of famous landmarks. Ryan inches forward and glances at the map, layered in photographs, chuckles thoughtfully, and turns back to join Alex, Julie, and Jim, gesturing at the map. Later, at the bar, Alex slips back in while Ryan lingers outside with Julie and Kara. They chuckle, and Julie shakes her head and glances down sadly as Kara gazes at her, with a pile of flower arrangements nearby. Ryan cruises up to his old school with Alex, and they hop out of the car, examining the long, low building. They skip across some snow and stride up to the entrance. Ryan tries the door, discovering it shut, and peers inside to discover darkness. He turns to Alex with a shrug, but she smirks and approaches a window, loosens a catch with a credit card, and slides it open. He seizes her hand and hoists her up, and they both crawl into a classroom, where they examine old newspaper photos of the basketball team and a picture in a trophy case. Outside by a loading bay, they perch on the stairs and embrace. In the gym, they observe the basketball team rehearse and smirk at each other. Kara calls, so Alex parks Ryan by the church. Ryan jogs up to the church entrance, swings open the door, and dashes up some stairs. He strolls into the church and discovers Julie, in white, sitting with her bridesmaids, who wear cerise, weeping. They notice Ryan, and Kara strolls over to him as he gazes at Julie, who wipes tears from her eyes.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Monica rotates around and heads off. Kevin looks out of the window of a blimp as it ascends into the ocean. In Paris, Jamie holds the replica of Sam and Pat in front of the cube-shaped Eiffel Tower. Kevin aims the film camera, and Jamie moves the replica closer. He takes a photograph while Jamie gazes at the replica. Kevin grins, and Jamie looks shocked before grinning warmly. In Toronto, a helicopter comes in to land. Jamie and Kevin walk through the bus terminal, with him pulling a green wheelie case and her a similar, neat orange one. Later, they walk into the Cabin Lodge, an Italian villa-themed inn, and join a long queue of robots checking in. Kevin notices a third kiosk with no line. As Kevin opens a motel room door, his cousin Lisa walks up holding a stack of books. Jamie and Kevin walk into their elegantly furnished suite, where Kevin picks up a pamphlet with a sketch of Sam and Pat on the front. Sam hugs Kevin, and Pat strolls over. There's a large sketch of Europe on the ceiling, pinned with several drawings of the replica of Sam and Pat in front of famous sculptures. Kevin steps back and looks at the sketch, covered in illustrations, smiles thoughtfully, and goes back to join Jamie, Sam, and Pat, gesturing at the sketch. Later, at the café, Jamie goes back in while Kevin waits outside with Sam and Lisa. They grin, and Sam nods and looks down happily as Lisa looks at her, with a crate of fruit arrangements nearby. Kevin drives up to his old library with Jamie, and they get out of the truck, looking at the tall, narrow building. They slog across some sand and walk up to the gateway. Kevin tries the gate, finding it locked, and squints inside to see shadows. He turns to Jamie resignedly, but she chuckles and goes to a hatch, undoes a latch with a business card, and pulls it open. He grabs her shoe and hoists her up, and they both clamber into a lab, where they look at old magazine sketches of the soccer team and a painting in a glass case. Outside by a shipping dock, they sit on the railings and hug. In the rink, they watch the soccer team practice and chuckle at each other. Lisa calls, so Jamie drops Kevin off by the library. Kevin runs up to the library entrance, opens the hatch, and runs up some steps. He walks into the library and finds Sam, in green, sitting with her ushers, who wear turquoise, laughing. They see Kevin, and Lisa goes over to him as he looks at Sam, who wipes tears from her cheeks.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Samantha twirls around and wanders off. Dylan gazes out of the window of a helicopter as it descends into the valley. In Miami, Jordan cradles the sketch of Laura and Matt in front of the dome-shaped Space Needle. Dylan directs the video camera, and Jordan drifts the sketch nearer. He records a video while Jordan gawks at the sketch. Dylan chuckles, and Jordan appears confused before laughing joyfully. In Denver, a helicopter prepares to take off. Jordan and Dylan stroll through the train station, with him dragging a green duffel bag and her a matching, tidy blue one. Later, they enter the Alpine Inn, a Bavarian-themed hostel, and join a small line of patrons checking out. Dylan observes a third counter with no line. As Dylan closes a dormitory room window, his brother Mark walks by holding a basket of laundry. Jordan and Dylan explore their lavishly designed room, where Dylan grabs a printed pamphlet with a photo of Laura and Matt on the cover. Laura embraces Dylan, and Matt approaches. There's an enormous globe of the world on the wall, adorned with many pictures of the sketch of Laura and Matt in front of iconic sites. Dylan retreats and observes the globe, filled with snapshots, grins reflectively, and returns to join Jordan, Laura, and Matt, gesturing at the globe. Later, at the lounge, Jordan slips out while Dylan lingers inside with Laura and Mark. They chuckle, and Laura shakes her head and gazes up mournfully as Mark watches her, with a stack of postcards nearby. Dylan walks toward his former library with Jordan, and they exit the vehicle, observing the tall, narrow building. They tread across some sand and approach the gate. Dylan pushes the gate, finding it open, and peers inside to glimpse sunlight. He turns to Jordan excitedly, but she frowns and goes to a door, applies force with a screwdriver, and swings it open. He steadies her elbow and hoists her up, and they both scramble into a hallway, where they examine antique yearbook clippings of the debate team and a painting in a glass case. Outside by a platform, they stand against the railing and hug. In the auditorium, they observe the dance troupe rehearsing and smirk at each other. Mark calls, so Jordan drops Dylan off by the library. Dylan sprints toward the library entrance, swings the door, and dashes up some paths. He steps into the library and discovers Laura, in red, standing with her attendants, who wear lavender, laughing. They notice Dylan, and Mark rushes over to him as he watches Laura, who wipes smiles from her cheeks.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Natalie twirls around and marches away. Ryan peers out of the window of a blimp as it floats into the clouds. In Las Vegas, Alex clutches the silhouette of Julie and Jim in front of the cube-shaped Bellagio Hotel. Ryan points the old-fashioned film camera, and Alex shifts the silhouette closer. He sketches a drawing while Alex gapes at the silhouette. Ryan laughs, and Alex looks astonished before grinning broadly. In Milwaukee, a blimp descends to hover. Alex and Ryan wander through the bus station terminal, with him dragging a blue duffel bag and her a matching, tidy yellow one. Later, they saunter into the Chalet Cabins, an alpine cottage-themed resort, and join a short line of people waiting for tickets. Ryan spots a second kiosk with no line. As Ryan closes a cabin door, his sister Kara ambles up holding a crate of fruit. Alex and Ryan step into their flamboyantly decorated room, where Ryan glances at a printed flyer with a drawing of Julie and Jim on the front. Julie pats Ryan on the back, and Jim walks over. There's a large globe of the Earth on the shelf, adorned with several drawings of the silhouette of Julie and Jim in front of renowned monuments. Ryan steps aside and gazes at the globe, covered in illustrations, chuckles pensively, and goes back to join Alex, Julie, and Jim, gesturing at the globe. Later, at the café, Alex walks in while Ryan lingers outside with Julie and Kara. They chuckle, and Julie shakes her head and glances down somberly as Kara glances at her, with a wagon of garden tools nearby. Ryan cycles up to his old library with Alex, and they hop off the bicycles, glancing at the tall, narrow structure. They trudge across some sand and stroll up to the gate. Ryan tries the gate, finding it barred, and peeks inside to see emptiness. He turns to Alex dejectedly, but she beams and heads to a hatch, unfastens a bolt with a hairpin, and pushes it ajar. He grips her wrist and hoists her up, and they both scramble into a gallery, where they gaze at old magazine clippings of the volleyball team and a sketch in a display case. Outside by a platform, they perch on the railing and embrace. In the theater, they observe the volleyball team rehearse and smirk at each other. Kara texts, so Alex drops Ryan off by the park. Ryan sprints up to the park entrance, swings the gate, and sprints up some paths. He strolls into the community center and finds Julie, in blue, sitting with her ushers, who wear green, frowning. They notice Ryan, and Kara strides over to him as he gazes at Julie, who brushes tears from her cheeks.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Clara twirls forward and jets away. Marcus gazes through the porthole of a submarine as it dives into the ocean. In New York, Taylor grips the silhouette of Sam and Terry beside the cube-shaped Empire State Building. Marcus targets the film camera, and Taylor shifts the silhouette nearer. He sketches an image while Taylor glares at the silhouette. Marcus chuckles, and Taylor appears bewildered before giggling softly. In Boston, a submarine surfaces to dock. Taylor and Marcus stroll through the train station, with him dragging a green leather suitcase and her an oversized, patterned yellow one. Later, they skip into the Alpine Cabins, a Nordic cabin-themed inn, and join a lengthy line of tourists registering. Marcus spots an additional booth with no line. As Marcus closes a cabin door, his cousin Emma strolls up clutching a tub of groceries. Taylor and Marcus tiptoe into their extravagantly decorated cabin, where Marcus grabs an illustrated magazine with a sketch of Sam and Terry on the cover. Sam embraces Marcus, and Terry ambles over. There's a grand chart of Canada on the ceiling, taped with numerous sketches of the silhouette of Sam and Terry beside renowned monuments. Marcus steps aside and gazes at the chart, draped in sketches, grins introspectively, and returns to join Taylor, Sam, and Terry, gesturing at the chart. Later, at the café, Taylor heads outside while Marcus waits indoors with Sam and Emma. They grin, and Sam shakes her head and glances up cheerfully as Emma stares at her, with a pile of gift baskets nearby. Marcus sails up to his former library with Taylor, and they climb out of the tram, admiring the tall, narrow structure. They march across some leaves and approach the portal. Marcus yanks the gate, discovering it sealed, and squints inside to see brightness. He turns to Taylor hopefully, but she frowns and marches to a skylight, secures a hinge with a keychain, and slides it shut. He tugs her arm and hauls her down, and they both scramble out of an auditorium, where they study recent magazine clippings of the chess club and a painting in a display case. Outside by a storage dock, they stand on the ladder and whisper. In the auditorium, they observe the chess club strategize and smirk at each other. Emma writes, so Taylor drops Marcus off by the market. Marcus jogs up to the market threshold, swings the gate, and jogs down some escalators. He strides into the market and encounters Sam, in orange, lounging with her assistants, who wear teal, laughing. They spot Marcus, and Emma nods over to him as he glances at Sam, who rubs tears from her eyes.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Natalie departs as Ryan looks out a jet window. In Las Vegas, Alex and Ryan photograph a cut-out of Julie and Jim in front of the Luxor Hotel. Surprised, Alex smiles warmly. In Milwaukee, they arrive at an airport, each with a wheelie case, and head to the Swiss-themed Chalet Suites hotel. Ryan spots a map pinned with photos of Julie and Jim's cut-out at landmarks. Ryan reflects on the map before joining Alex, Julie, and Jim. Later, Alex returns inside a bar while Ryan lingers outside with Julie and Kara. Ryan drives to his old school with Alex, finds a locked door, but she opens a window. They explore a classroom and old basketball photos, then kiss by a loading bay. At the gym, they watch the basketball team. Alex drops Ryan at a church, where he finds Julie crying with her bridesmaids. Kara comforts him as he looks at Julie wiping her tears.

test_cases.description: Ryan notices a second counter with no queue  Natalie spins around and heads off  They tramp across some snow and walk up to the entrance  He turns to Alex resignedly but she grins and goes to a window undoes a catch with a credit card and pulls it open  He walks into the church and finds Julie in white sitting with her bridesmaids who wear cerise crying  Ryan smiles and Alex looks surprised before smiling warmly  Outside by a loading bay they sit on the stairs and kiss  Kara calls so  Ryan tries the door finding it locked and peers inside to see darkness  Ryan steps back and looks at the map covered in photographs smiles thoughtfully and goes back to join Alex  In the gym they watch the basketball team practice and grin at each other  Julie and Jim pointing at the map  Later at the bar Alex goes back in while Ryan waits outside with Julie and Kara  Alex and Ryan walk through the airport terminal with him pulling a black wheelie case and her a similar neat red one  They smile and Julie nods and looks down sadly as Kara looks at her with a box of flower arrangements nearby  Ryan looks out of the window of a jet as it rises into the sky  Alex drops Ryan off by the church  Ryan drives up to his old school with Alex and they get out of the car looking at the long low building  Alex and Ryan walk into their gaudily furnished room where Ryan picks up a photocopied booklet with a picture of Julie and Jim on the front  They see Ryan and Kara goes over to him as he looks at Julie who wipes tears from her eyes Julie hugs Ryan and Jim comes over  In Las Vegas Alex holds the cutout of Julie and Jim in front of the pyramidshaped Luxor Hotel  Ryan aims the digital camera and Alex moves the cutout closer  Ryan runs up to the church entrance opens the door and runs up some stairs  In Milwaukee a jet comes in to land  He takes a picture while Alex stares at the cutout  Later they walk into the Chalet Suites a Swiss lodgethemed hotel and join a short queue of people checking in  As Ryan opens a hotel room door his sister Kara walks up holding a basket of washing  There's a large map of the US on the wall pinned with several photos of the cutout of Julie and Jim in front of famous landmarks  He grabs her foot and heaves her up and they both clamber into a classroom where they look at old newspaper photos of the basketball team and a picture in a trophy case

test_cases.name: Rotate Half Paragraph
test_cases.description: Julie and Jim pointing at the map  Later at the bar Alex goes back in while Ryan waits outside with Julie and Kara  They smile and Julie nods and looks down sadly as Kara looks at her with a box of flower arrangements nearby  Ryan drives up to his old school with Alex and they get out of the car looking at the long low building  They tramp across some snow and walk up to the entrance  Ryan tries the door finding it locked and peers inside to see darkness  He turns to Alex resignedly but she grins and goes to a window undoes a catch with a credit card and pulls it open  He grabs her foot and heaves her up and they both clamber into a classroom where they look at old newspaper photos of the basketball team and a picture in a trophy case  Outside by a loading bay they sit on the stairs and kiss  In the gym they watch the basketball team practice and grin at each other  Kara calls so  Alex drops Ryan off by the church  Ryan runs up to the church entrance opens the door and runs up some stairs  He walks into the church and finds Julie in white sitting with her bridesmaids who wear cerise crying  They see Ryan and Kara goes over to him as he looks at Julie who wipes tears from her eyes Natalie spins around and heads off  Ryan looks out of the window of a jet as it rises into the sky  In Las Vegas Alex holds the cutout of Julie and Jim in front of the pyramidshaped Luxor Hotel  Ryan aims the digital camera and Alex moves the cutout closer  He takes a picture while Alex stares at the cutout  Ryan smiles and Alex looks surprised before smiling warmly  In Milwaukee a jet comes in to land  Alex and Ryan walk through the airport terminal with him pulling a black wheelie case and her a similar neat red one  Later they walk into the Chalet Suites a Swiss lodgethemed hotel and join a short queue of people checking in  Ryan notices a second counter with no queue  As Ryan opens a hotel room door his sister Kara walks up holding a basket of washing  Alex and Ryan walk into their gaudily furnished room where Ryan picks up a photocopied booklet with a picture of Julie and Jim on the front  Julie hugs Ryan and Jim comes over  There's a large map of the US on the wall pinned with several photos of the cutout of Julie and Jim in front of famous landmarks  Ryan steps back and looks at the map covered in photographs smiles thoughtfully and goes back to join Alex
